title: Chasuble with Medallion Depicting John the Baptist

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of linen, plain weave underlaid with silk, plain weave with insert medallion of silk, warp-float faced satin weave; embroidered with silk and gilt- and silvered-metal-strip-wrapped silk and linen in satin, split and stem stitches; couching and french knots; edged with silk and gilt-metal-strip-wrapped silk, plain weave with patterning wefts and complementary weft weave tapes; lined with silk, plain weave.

artist_display:
After a fresco by Andrea del Sarto (Italian, 1486–1530) (Tondo only)
Italy
medium_display: Linen, plain weave underlaid with silk, plain weave with insert medallion of silk, warp-float faced satin weave; embroidered with silk and gilt- and silvered-metal-strip-wrapped silk and linen in satin, split and stem stitches; couching and French knots; edged with silk and gilt-metal-strip-wrapped silk, plain weave with patterning wefts and complementary weft weave tapes; lined with silk, plain weave
publication_history:
Isle Hecht, "An Embroidery after a Fresco by Andrea del Sarto," Bulletin of The Art Institute of Chicago vol. LXIX, no. 5 (Sept.–Oct. 1975): 14-17 (ill.).

Christa C. Mayer Thurman, Raiment for the Lord's Service: A Thousand Years of Western Vestments, exh. cat. (Chicago: The Art Institute of Chicago, 1975), cat. 71, 176-177 (ill.)

Christa C. Mayer Thurman, Textiles in The Art Institute of Chicago (Chicago: The Art Institute of Chicago, 1992), 44-45, 50, 144 (ill.).
exhibition_history:
Art Institute of Chicago, Raiment for the Lord's Service: A Thousand Years of Western Vestments, Nov. 15, 1975–Jan. 18, 1976.

Art Institute of Chicago, Agnes Allerton Gallery, Vestments and Liturgical Textiles from the Permanent Collection, July 27–Oct. 9, 1983.

Art Institute of Chicago, Department of European Decorative Arts, Gunsaulus Hall, Sept. 6, 1988-Apr. l 10, 1989.

Art Institute of Chicago, Elizabeth F. Cheney and Agnes Allerton Textile Galleries, European Textile Masterpieces from Coptic Times through the 19th Century, Sept.r 27, 1989–Jan. 22, 1990.

Art Institute of Chicago, Department of European Decorative Arts, Gunsaulus Hall, May 2-July 2, 1990.

Art Institute of Chicago, Elizabeth F. Cheney and Agnes Allerton Textile Galleries, Textile Masterpieces from the Art Institute of Chicago's Collection, Feb. 17–May 2, 1993.

The Art Institute of Chicago, Elizabeth F. Cheney and Agnes Allerton Textile Galleries, Gloria in Excelsis Deo: Heralding a Vestment Collection, September 11, 1996–January 12, 1997

The Art Institute of Chicago, Department of European Decorative Arts, Gunsaulus Hall, September 1, 1999- January 25, 2000
provenance_text: Blumka Gallery, NY, by Mar. 30, 1970 [Incoming permanent receipt RX7934, Apr. 2, 1970; copy in curatorial object file]; sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1971.

input: Chasuble with Medallion Depicting John the Baptist
